title: Privacy/Incognito cookies shared with non private window
content:
So I'm running a Firefox Developer Edition (I do this to have my work related stuff separated from my personal stuff).

I was testing A/B testing software on our website, when I noticed that Private window shared some of the non-Private window cookies.

I have made a recording of the issue in action. On the left side is a private mode window (notice the missing extensions), on the right side is a normal window. They are both open on the same page and first thing to notice, is when I refresh the private window, cookies in inspector "flash" in both windows, indicating that there are changes. After that, I'm interested in two cookies: "gbuuid" and "growthBookVariants", it seems like they are shared and when I refresh one windows, it's value is "synced" to the second window.

Now this is annoying, as I have to clear those cookies to test if I get a different variant. When a colleague tested it on Windows, it didn't happen so maybe it's something with my settings/extensions? I attached my privacy settings, but when I fiddled with those, nothing seemed to change.
creator: T.Kallup

title: Eltüntek a firefox beállításaim.
content: Helló! Problémám, hogy a tegnapi bejelentkezésemre elvesztek a firefox böngésző beállításaim! Egy új Windows és Linuix telepítés után hiába jelentkezek be és hiába szinkronizálok, mindenképp egy alap firefoxot kapok. A beállításaim, a könyvjelzőim és minden, minden elveszett. Jelenleg még a laptopomon vannak meg a beállítások, mert ott kikapcsoltam a wifit, mielőtt elindítottam a Firefoxot, de ott nem merek fellépni a netre, mert félek, hogy ott is az új, azaz az alapállapothoz szinkronizálja a böngészőt. Eddig nem találtam olyan opciót, hogy mondjuk lementhessem a Firefox állapotát, mert ha rákeresek, akkor is a szinkronizálást ajánlgatja.
creator: buci62

title: Update doesn't work
content: The last two times Firefox has updated, it's also stopped working. The problem was the same both times: the app takes several minutes to open and when (if) it does, pages won't load. Any tabs I open remain blank white pages. The first time this happened, the problem fixed itself after a few days. This time I've been unable to use Firefox since the 24 October 2023 update. I've tried updating my OS, uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox, and rebooting several times but nothing has worked. Hope you can help.

title: Using backspace key to go back one URL
content: I used to be able to use the backspace key to go back one URL in a given window. Now, even though I have gone to about:config and changed browser.backspace_action = 0 to 'true', this no longer works, at least not with my new Windows 11 computer. I tried closing and re-opening Mozilla with the new preference, and again with closing, restarting the computer, and then re-opening Mozilla. Please help if you can. Thank you so much.
